stdReg2 1.0.3
  • Reference
    • Implementing custom and new methods for standardization
    • Estimation of causal effects using stdReg2
  • Changelog

Provide tidy output from a std_custom object for use in downstream computations

Source: R/standardize_custom.R
tidy.std_custom.Rd

Tidy summarizes information about the components of the standardized regression fit.

Usage

# S3 method for class 'std_custom'
tidy(x, ...)

Arguments

x

An object of class std_custom

...

Not currently used

Value

A data.frame

Examples

set.seed(6)
n <- 100
Z <- rnorm(n)
X <- rnorm(n, mean = Z)
Y <- rbinom(n, 1, prob = (1 + exp(X + Z))^(-1))
dd <- data.frame(Z, X, Y)
prob_predict.glm <- function(...) predict.glm(..., type = "response")

x <- standardize(
  fitter = "glm",
  arguments = list(
    formula = Y ~ X * Z,
    family = "binomial"
  ),
  predict_fun = prob_predict.glm,
  data = dd,
  values = list(X = seq(-1, 1, 0.1)),
  B = 100,
  reference = 0,
  contrasts = "difference"
)
#>
